pullRequest.title: Avoid tile mutex
pullRequest.bodyText:
Follow-up to #6046
Note that I haven't done any performance testing, I just verified the changes seem to work.
Functional Changes

[] New map or map update
[] New Feature

[x] Code Cleanup or refactor

[] Problem fix:  
[] Other:   
Testing

I started a local game and the tiles loaded no problem.

commit.message: Move TILE_SIZE constant to Tile class
Don't keep unecessary copies of Images around

nodes.bodyText: I just noticed "hardcoding" the bounds to TILE_SIZE is no longer neccessary in the final form of this PR 🤔

As you can see the only thing that "mutex" does now is synchronize the access to contents and isDirty as a single operation.
Not sure if it would work without any unintended problems if we made contents a concurrent collection of some sort and removed the mutex. Currently calling new PriorityQueue<>(contents) is a constant time operation, changing the type of contents would make it O(n * log n).
We could however use a concurrent set where the draw level is compared, and if even we compare the hashCodes or something in order not to "remove" "duplicate" tiles with the same draw level as others.

Does it make sense to have drawImage to also return the rendered image?
EG:
final var image = tile.drawImage(gameData, uiContext.getMapData())
Kinda odd as GameData is quite mutable. I wonder if this would be more easily communicated if we extracted the logic that needs GameData to a method. Thoughts?
Thoughts to replace this with @Getter and move and consolidate the comment to the image variable?
Minor, Tile.TILE_SIZE is a candidate for a static import, used quite a bit.
